alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 7:16PM EST until January 10 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Delaware... White Clay Creek Near Newark affecting New Castle County. For the White Clay Creek...including Newark...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Clay Creek near Newark. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flooding begins into adjacent open fields. At 13.3 feet, Delaware Route 7, Stanton Christiana Road, begins to flood. At 13.5 feet, Businesses on Delaware Route 7 begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.0 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 15.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.9 feet on 01/19/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date White Clay Creek Newark 13.0 9.0 Tue 6 pm 5.8 MSG 15.9 1am 1/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 730 AM EST.
